cells.m_text_in:
# TODO LIST
graph view for adding available combos
	comments to provide places explicitly
		for the global places, it's a bad idea to parse it as a combo
actual qinfo / qcombo ac
	slot analysis + a command list
	--
	qinfo - fill the params
	TOK_COMMENT: exact match
	cross-file combos
	qcombo - location-specific pieces
		e.g. handle another URL in an HTTP server
		prefered location of combo parts
			part-to-slot match
		--- UI design
		graph-like?
		or just a list of available qcombo / qifunc s
		could use ~ in combos
			void{location=globals}
			which is messy
			one could just provide suggestions on graph node selection
				graph is an *interpretation*
				just build it and expose the ops
					focus on "add node" and the game course
(test) double click on shader error
weird bookmark display in tophint for certain folding setups
qcombo could have typed args
bring function hints / ... near the cursor
dbl-clicking a partially-out-of-view notebook cell caption
style enforcement
	potentially per-project
tagged code in md
	hotkeys for browsing help
		help window focus issues in general
	bad focus in the help window
(reproduce?) project-in-unopenable-location crash
iOS bluetooth keyboard support
	- keyCommands
graph
	each tag as a node, with order-aware drag-connecting
		and maybe a description
		just drag the code into the editor window
			with potential positioning hints
				(function(){})() indicates init code, etc.
			carrying a tag
		could provide tag-specific completion
			or just modify the code in the doc on the fly based on some more intuitive UI
			or something auto-edit-like
		test: game programming course
	show tag-related documentation on F1
	----
	the point is the component-based programming
		variable meaning list in holder tags
		variable-type list
			annotate type with semantics
			use type as goals and to select actions (APIs)
stop / clear buttons in notebook v2
F5/CTRL+F5 indicators
touch: scrolling, touch detection, ac modes, mouse over, typos
	touch-awareness
tab switch
	to previously edited file?
		navigate backward - but it isn't reliable for this
	an option
drag-out support
	secondary windows
		rendering works as is
		region is mixed up
	the smart rerendering FBO... one FBO for each window? only one FBO for the frontmost?
release on github, again
	linux buildable source .tar.gz
		build-it-yourself release
remove the help system?
	links in help
	running a markdown: open as help page?
runtime completion
	Python / node.js
	actually run an interpreter session and dump the "require"d objects to a file
		security concerns...
code beautifier
	help code / smart paste auto beautification
diff to generate undo ops on reload
AC plugins
	tex ref
	bash
	js member name in certain strings
	--
	multi-source combination
		some candidates may smash a context
		put this in as a property of the candidates
	HTML tag properties, CSS
	providing explanation in AC sources
put plugins in ~/.qpad
make top hint / notification dodge MouseOver / cursor
swap ctrl+shift+v and ctrl+v?
binary editor reloading?
rendering
	true AA for roundrect
tex
	port more of deferred.qpadscript
	enabling/disabling plugins in menu
CJK PPM:
	work in conjunction with IME?
		could have blind prediction...
	iphone prediction isn't that useful
	--
	or LSTM
binary editor
	duk buffer size limit
dedicated mobile/mobile-like UI / console UI
	only use the typeable part of a keyboard
	buttons for common actions
	(maybe) vi-like commands
	terminal / mobile keyboard support
		or just buy a keyboard with Fn keys
notebook cell ops undo/redo
nested directory in the file browser
`#pragma region` folding
a few built-in themes
	~/.qpad_debug/theme_dark1.json
mac
	zoom hotkey
	system menu
Unicode-aware case handling
	we don't want to screw the case insensitive performance
for non-familiar users:
	more concise system for translation / hotkey scripts
	display a "how to replace" hint when one presses ctrl+r
	[ new window ] and [ button: ... ] in help
peek definition:
	CEO and hide cannot overlap

@echo off
rem build script for the project
rem [button: Debug]
rem set LANG=zh_CN.utf8
jc --readable_c_code zmain.jc --run
cells.m_text_out:
s7main.c
duktape.c
spaprt_portable.c
s7res.c
   Creating library ./bin/win32/zmain.lib and object ./bin/win32/zmain.exp

cells.m_text_in:
# TODO LIST
lightweight graph-based editing
	opening sync - the graph is the secondary level
	inline @in: we won't use code references twice
	rework the var system to be more convenient
		just replace names like __VAR_A with unique instances, within the same node
	"file update" node
		ignore non-tagged regions in the output file, only update the tagged parts
	could use the notebook system to manage code nodes in a graph
	lightweight ops
		*add* a node to a program
			inline in-port
		convert git diff to a node
	as a way of organizing build steps and semantic code piece grouping
		meta-makefile + patch management
		patch: collection of code blocks and their placements
			persistent bookmarks
			generate from git diff / global search / manual marking
	core op: code block tag
		tag a range of code with a name
		the ranges can nest
			they can serve as both out and in ports
		nested ranges are displayed as graph edges
		there is no sync: the tags merely serve as visualization / locating aid
		tags are organized using external files
			just cite them in literate-programming-like documents
		tagged code can be easily moved around
			e.g. from an example to real production code
			dup a document, then reconnect
		organize the documents as files
			they could be just implemented as files
			and have the references rendered as views to the actual code
	--
	implementation
		ctrl+b: create code block and copy block name
		md file hook:
			when a line refers to a block, show a view into it
peek definition
	render an overlay of that editorwindow around the id in question
	do it VS-style: y translation overlay
	could be related to the graph thing
multi-example auto-edit
	the graph merge algorithm can't be applied to our DP approach

test dismantling on a copy of the main project
	build/strata.jc
	--
	pull out / pull to / pull out to
sometimes we're just using it as an organizing tool
	rework qpad hotkeys
		pull selection out to a node, then create an input port to connect it
		right-click menu
	we should not care about node file names
applying to existing projects
- (test) choose-able build output dir
- "dismantling aid" in qpad
- the qiniu project?
- the btc trader trainer?
	
redirected run for debugging
	use existing build / run systems... notebook

apply it to something
	try-hard downloader
	custom IME for phone qpad
dedicated preview nodes
	preview output for zjs script
		md / qpad rendering functions
	or invoke some external application
	only those needing editing UIs should be inside
	---
	better run the thing in the final system
(test) @out format=var
UI overhaul
	area labels
	put nodes on top of edges
	package updating UI
		package-groups: original caption
		show package dependency as nodes
		could also un-depending packages
node y ordering:
	only set rebuild flag when ordering actually changes
	use edge y to account for dots
	when build-ungrouping, scale down inner node y values
	--
	use top-bottom execution flow
make newly-created code snippets connect to all dangling in-ports on selected nodes
default interface layout: put the code editor window somewhere more convenient
drag-node-to-edge
git merging:
	https://github.com/dominictarr/xdiff
re-purpose the graph editor for shader editor?
	preview-only node class

@echo off
rem build script for the project
rem [button: Debug]
set LANG=zh_CN.utf8
jc --readable_c_code -awin64 qpad.jc --run

@echo off
rem build script for 'qpad.jc'
rem [button: Release]
cd /d c:/tp/qpad
git log --pretty=format:%%H -n 1 > res/misc/commit.txt
jc -brelease -awin64 qpad.jc
jc -brelease -awin32 qpad.jc
rem jc -brelease -amac qpad.jc
cd bin\win32_release
del qpad3beta_32.7z
7z a qpad3beta_32.7z qpad.exe
cd /d c:\tp\qpad
cd bin\win64_release
del qpad3beta_64.7z
7z a qpad3beta_64.7z qpad.exe
del c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad_old.exe
ren c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad.exe qpad_old.exe
copy qpad.exe c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad.exe
cells.m_text_out:
s7main.c
s7res.c
   Creating library ./bin/win64_release/qpad.lib and object ./bin/win64_release/qpad.exp
s7main.c
s7res.c
   Creating library ./bin/win32_release/qpad.lib and object ./bin/win32_release/qpad.exp

@echo off
rem build script for 'c:/tp/qpad/qpad.jc'
rem [button: Release]
cd /d c:/tp/qpad
jc -brelease -awin64 c:/tp/qpad/qpad.jc
jc -brelease -awin32 c:/tp/qpad/qpad.jc
cd bin\win32_release
del qpad3beta_32.7z

cd /d c:\tp\qpad
cd bin\win64_release

del c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad_old.exe
ren c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad.exe qpad_old.exe
copy qpad.exe c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad.exe

cells.m_text_in:
#!/bin/sh
#[button: Translate]
# After this is done, re-run qpad to generate 'translation.json'
cd /c/tp/qpad/res
grep -ERoh text:\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\) * > ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh UI\._\\\(\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\)\\\) * >> ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh UI\.Format\\\(\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\), * >> ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh tooltip:\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\) * >> ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh ,name:\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\) * >> ../build/translation.txt
